channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Senate may probe hospitals for overcharging — Go
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: Sen. Bong Go said the Senate is ready to investigate reports that some hospitals are overcharging patients in their medical bills.

item.title: Local test kits key to reopening economy — Salceda
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: A member of the House of Representatives lauded yesterday the commercial release of Philippine-made coronavirus disease 2019 test kits, saying these would eventually pave the way for rejuvenating the country’s nearly idle economy.

item.title: PCSO to resume lotto games operation on August 4
item.author: Rainier Allan Ronda
item.description: The Philippine Charity Sweepstakes Office will resume operating lotto games on Aug. 4.

item.title: More than 3 million workers affected by pandemic – DOLE
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: The number of workers who suffered loss of income and employment nationwide due to the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic has exceeded three million, the Department of Labor and Employment reported.

item.title: Palace: No comment on more Congress heat on ABS-CBN
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Malacañang is mum on the plan of some lawmakers to impose more sanctions against troubled broadcast network ABS-CBN, saying these are individual views of House members.

item.title: PNP chief says Philippnes winning war on drugs
item.author: Neil Jayson Servallos
item.description: The country is winning the war against illegal drugs.

item.title: Palace admits slow distribution of aid
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Malacañang yesterday admitted that the distribution of the second tranche of aid for sectors affected by the coronavirus pandemic has been slow, but officials remain hopeful that it would be completed by the end of the month.

item.title: COA vows continuous audit of COVID-19 expenses
item.author: Elizabeth Marcelo
item.description: The Commission on Audit has vowed that there will be no letup in the audit trail of government expenses in connection with the response to the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: DOH: COVID-19 case clustering in 600 areas
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: More than 600 areas in the country have a clustering of cases of the coronavirus disease 2019, the Department of Health (DOH) said yesterday.

item.title: ‘Terror law can be repealed if abused’
item.author: Paolo Romero
item.description: Congress can repeal the controversial Anti-Terrorism Act if authorities are found to be abusing its provisions, Senate President Vicente Sotto III said yesterday, even as he asked critics to give time for the government to implement it.
